schemas.name: resource_version
schemas.description: An opaque value that represents the internal version of this persistent volume claim that can be used by clients to determine when persistent volume claim has changed. Read more: https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/devel/api-conventions.md#concurrency-control-and-consistency

schemas.name: self_link
schemas.description: A URL representing this persistent volume claim.

schemas.name: uid
schemas.description: The unique in time and space value for this persistent volume claim. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#uids

schemas.name: spec
schemas.description: Spec defines the desired characteristics of a volume requested by a pod author. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/persistent-volumes#persistentvolumeclaims

schemas.name: access_modes
schemas.description: A set of the desired access modes the volume should have. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/persistent-volumes#access-modes-1

schemas.name: resources
schemas.description: A list of the minimum resources the volume should have. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/persistent-volumes#resources

schemas.name: limits
schemas.description: Map describing the maximum amount of compute resources allowed. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/compute-resources/

schemas.name: requests
schemas.description: Map describing the minimum amount of compute resources required. If this is omitted for a container, it defaults to `limits` if that is explicitly specified, otherwise to an implementation-defined value. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/compute-resources/

schemas.name: selector
schemas.description: A label query over volumes to consider for binding.

schemas.name: match_expressions
schemas.description: A list of label selector requirements. The requirements are ANDed.

schemas.name: key
schemas.description: The label key that the selector applies to.

schemas.name: operator
schemas.description: A key's relationship to a set of values. Valid operators ard `In`, `NotIn`, `Exists` and `DoesNotExist`.

schemas.name: values
schemas.description: An array of string values. If the operator is `In` or `NotIn`, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is `Exists` or `DoesNotExist`, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

schemas.name: match_labels
schemas.description: A map of {key,value} pairs. A single {key,value} in the matchLabels map is equivalent to an element of `match_expressions`, whose key field is "key", the operator is "In", and the values array contains only "value". The requirements are ANDed.

schemas.name: storage_class_name
schemas.description: Name of the storage class requested by the claim

schemas.name: volume_name
schemas.description: The binding reference to the PersistentVolume backing this claim.

schemas.name: wait_until_bound
schemas.description: Whether to wait for the claim to reach `Bound` state (to find volume in which to claim the space)

schemas.name: metadata
schemas.description: Standard pod's metadata. More info: https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/devel/api-conventions.md#metadata

schemas.name: annotations
schemas.description: An unstructured key value map stored with the pod that may be used to store arbitrary metadata. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/annotations

schemas.name: generate_name
schemas.description: Prefix, used by the server, to generate a unique name ONLY IF the `name` field has not been provided. This value will also be combined with a unique suffix. Read more: https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/devel/api-conventions.md#idempotency

schemas.name: generation
schemas.description: A sequence number representing a specific generation of the desired state.

schemas.name: labels
schemas.description: Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize (scope and select) the pod. May match selectors of replication controllers and services. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/labels

schemas.name: name
schemas.description: Name of the pod, must be unique. Cannot be updated. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#names

schemas.name: namespace
schemas.description: Namespace defines the space within which name of the pod must be unique.

schemas.name: resource_version
schemas.description: An opaque value that represents the internal version of this pod that can be used by clients to determine when pod has changed. Read more: https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/devel/api-conventions.md#concurrency-control-and-consistency

schemas.name: self_link
schemas.description: A URL representing this pod.

schemas.name: uid
schemas.description: The unique in time and space value for this pod. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#uids

schemas.name: spec
schemas.description: Spec of the pod owned by the cluster

schemas.name: active_deadline_seconds
schemas.description: Optional duration in seconds the pod may be active on the node relative to StartTime before the system will actively try to mark it failed and kill associated containers. Value must be a positive integer.

schemas.name: container
schemas.description: List of containers belonging to the pod. Containers cannot currently be added or removed. There must be at least one container in a Pod. Cannot be updated. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/containers

schemas.name: args
schemas.description: Arguments to the entrypoint. The docker image's CMD is used if this is not provided. Variable references $(VAR_NAME) are expanded using the container's environment. If a variable cannot be resolved, the reference in the input string will be unchanged. The $(VAR_NAME) syntax can be escaped with a double $$, ie: $$(VAR_NAME). Escaped references will never be expanded, regardless of whether the variable exists or not. Cannot be updated. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/containers#containers-and-commands

schemas.name: command
schemas.description: Entrypoint array. Not executed within a shell. The docker image's ENTRYPOINT is used if this is not provided. Variable references $(VAR_NAME) are expanded using the container's environment. If a variable cannot be resolved, the reference in the input string will be unchanged. The $(VAR_NAME) syntax can be escaped with a double $$, ie: $$(VAR_NAME). Escaped references will never be expanded, regardless of whether the variable exists or not. Cannot be updated. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/containers#containers-and-commands

schemas.name: env
schemas.description: List of environment variables to set in the container. Cannot be updated.

schemas.name: name
schemas.description: Name of the environment variable. Must be a C_IDENTIFIER

schemas.name: value
schemas.description: Variable references $(VAR_NAME) are expanded using the previous defined environment variables in the container and any service environment variables. If a variable cannot be resolved, the reference in the input string will be unchanged. The $(VAR_NAME) syntax can be escaped with a double $$, ie: $$(VAR_NAME). Escaped references will never be expanded, regardless of whether the variable exists or not. Defaults to "".

schemas.name: value_from
schemas.description: Source for the environment variable's value

schemas.name: config_map_key_ref
schemas.description: Selects a key of a ConfigMap.

schemas.name: key
schemas.description: The key to select.

schemas.name: name
schemas.description: Name of the referent. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#names

schemas.name: field_ref
schemas.description: Selects a field of the pod: supports metadata.name, metadata.namespace, metadata.labels, metadata.annotations, spec.nodeName, spec.serviceAccountName, status.podIP..

schemas.name: api_version
schemas.description: Version of the schema the FieldPath is written in terms of, defaults to "v1".

schemas.name: field_path
schemas.description: Path of the field to select in the specified API version

schemas.name: resource_field_ref
schemas.description: Selects a field of the pod: supports metadata.name, metadata.namespace, metadata.labels, metadata.annotations, spec.nodeName, spec.serviceAccountName, status.podIP..

schemas.name: resource
schemas.description: Resource to select

schemas.name: secret_key_ref
schemas.description: Selects a field of the pod: supports metadata.name, metadata.namespace, metadata.labels, metadata.annotations, spec.nodeName, spec.serviceAccountName, status.podIP..

schemas.name: key
schemas.description: The key of the secret to select from. Must be a valid secret key.

schemas.name: name
schemas.description: Name of the referent. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#names

schemas.name: image
schemas.description: Docker image name. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/images

schemas.name: image_pull_policy
schemas.description: Image pull policy. One of Always, Never, IfNotPresent. Defaults to Always if :latest tag is specified, or IfNotPresent otherwise. Cannot be updated. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/images#updating-images

schemas.name: lifecycle
schemas.description: Actions that the management system should take in response to container lifecycle events

schemas.name: post_start
schemas.description: post_start is called immediately after a container is created. If the handler fails, the container is terminated and restarted according to its restart policy. Other management of the container blocks until the hook completes. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/container-environment#hook-details

schemas.name: exec
schemas.description: exec specifies the action to take.

schemas.name: command
schemas.description: Command is the command line to execute inside the container, the working directory for the command is root ('/') in the container's filesystem. The command is simply exec'd, it is not run inside a shell, so traditional shell instructions. To use a shell, you need to explicitly call out to that shell. Exit status of 0 is treated as live/healthy and non-zero is unhealthy.

schemas.name: http_get
schemas.description: Specifies the http request to perform.

schemas.name: host
schemas.description: Host name to connect to, defaults to the pod IP. You probably want to set "Host" in httpHeaders instead.

schemas.name: http_header
schemas.description: Scheme to use for connecting to the host.

schemas.name: name
schemas.description: The header field name

schemas.name: value
schemas.description: The header field value

schemas.name: path
schemas.description: Path to access on the HTTP server.

schemas.name: port
schemas.description: Name or number of the port to access on the container. Number must be in the range 1 to 65535. Name must be an IANA_SVC_NAME.

schemas.name: scheme
schemas.description: Scheme to use for connecting to the host.

schemas.name: tcp_socket
schemas.description: TCPSocket specifies an action involving a TCP port. TCP hooks not yet supported

Regardless of the outcome of the handler, the container is eventually terminated. Other management of the container blocks until the hook completes. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/container-environment#hook-details

schemas.description: List of ports to expose from the container. Exposing a port here gives the system additional information about the network connections a container uses, but is primarily informational. Not specifying a port here DOES NOT prevent that port from being exposed. Any port which is listening on the default "0.0.0.0" address inside a container will be accessible from the network. Cannot be updated.

schemas.name: container_port
schemas.description: Number of port to expose on the pod's IP address. This must be a valid port number, 0 < x < 65536.

schemas.name: host_ip
schemas.description: What host IP to bind the external port to.

schemas.name: host_port
schemas.description: Number of port to expose on the host. If specified, this must be a valid port number, 0 < x < 65536. If HostNetwork is specified, this must match ContainerPort. Most containers do not need this.

schemas.name: name
schemas.description: If specified, this must be an IANA_SVC_NAME and unique within the pod. Each named port in a pod must have a unique name. Name for the port that can be referred to by services

schemas.name: protocol
schemas.description: Protocol for port. Must be UDP or TCP. Defaults to "TCP".

schemas.name: readiness_probe

schemas.name: security_context
schemas.description: Security options the pod should run with. More info: http://releases.k8s.io/HEAD/docs/design/security_context.md

schemas.name: capabilities
schemas.description: The capabilities to add/drop when running containers. Defaults to the default set of capabilities granted by the container runtime.

schemas.name: add
schemas.description: Added capabilities

schemas.name: drop
schemas.description: Removed capabilities

schemas.name: privileged
schemas.description: Run container in privileged mode. Processes in privileged containers are essentially equivalent to root on the host.

schemas.name: read_only_root_filesystem
schemas.description: Whether this container has a read-only root filesystem.

schemas.name: run_as_non_root
schemas.description: Indicates that the container must run as a non-root user. If true, the Kubelet will validate the image at runtime to ensure that it does not run as UID 0 (root) and fail to start the container if it does.

schemas.name: run_as_user
schemas.description: The UID to run the entrypoint of the container process. Defaults to user specified in image metadata if unspecified

schemas.name: se_linux_options
schemas.description: ImagePullSecrets is an optional list of references to secrets in the same namespace to use for pulling any of the images used by this PodSpec. If specified, these secrets will be passed to individual puller implementations for them to use. For example, in the case of docker, only DockerConfig type secrets are honored. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/images#specifying-imagepullsecrets-on-a-pod

schemas.name: level
schemas.description: Level is SELinux level label that applies to the container.

schemas.name: role
schemas.description: Role is a SELinux role label that applies to the container.

schemas.name: type
schemas.description: Type is a SELinux type label that applies to the container.

schemas.name: user
schemas.description: User is a SELinux user label that applies to the container.

schemas.name: stdin
schemas.description: Whether this container should allocate a buffer for stdin in the container runtime. If this is not set, reads from stdin in the container will always result in EOF.

schemas.name: stdin_once
schemas.description: Whether the container runtime should close the stdin channel after it has been opened by a single attach. When stdin is true the stdin stream will remain open across multiple attach sessions. If stdinOnce is set to true, stdin is opened on container start, is empty until the first client attaches to stdin, and then remains open and accepts data until the client disconnects, at which time stdin is closed and remains closed until the container is restarted. If this flag is false, a container processes that reads from stdin will never receive an EOF.

schemas.name: termination_message_path
schemas.description: Optional: Path at which the file to which the container's termination message will be written is mounted into the container's filesystem. Message written is intended to be brief final status, such as an assertion failure message. Defaults to /dev/termination-log. Cannot be updated.

schemas.name: tty
schemas.description: Whether this container should allocate a TTY for itself

schemas.name: volume_mount
schemas.description: Pod volumes to mount into the container's filesystem. Cannot be updated.

schemas.name: mount_path
schemas.description: Path within the container at which the volume should be mounted. Must not contain ':'.

schemas.name: name
schemas.description: This must match the Name of a Volume.

schemas.name: read_only
schemas.description: Mounted read-only if true, read-write otherwise (false or unspecified). Defaults to false.

schemas.name: sub_path
schemas.description: Path within the volume from which the container's volume should be mounted. Defaults to "" (volume's root).

schemas.name: working_dir
schemas.description: Container's working directory. If not specified, the container runtime's default will be used, which might be configured in the container image. Cannot be updated.

schemas.name: dns_policy
schemas.description: Set DNS policy for containers within the pod. One of 'ClusterFirst' or 'Default'. Defaults to 'ClusterFirst'.

schemas.name: host_ipc
schemas.description: Use the host's ipc namespace. Optional: Default to false.

schemas.name: host_network
schemas.description: Host networking requested for this pod. Use the host's network namespace. If this option is set, the ports that will be used must be specified.

schemas.name: host_pid
schemas.description: Use the host's pid namespace.

schemas.name: hostname

The command is simply exec'd, it is not run inside a shell, so traditional shell instructions. To use a shell, you need to explicitly call out to that shell. Exit status of 0 is treated as live/healthy and non-zero is unhealthy.

schemas.name: http_get
schemas.description: Specifies the http request to perform.

schemas.name: host
schemas.description: Host name to connect to, defaults to the pod IP. You probably want to set "Host" in httpHeaders instead.

schemas.name: http_header
schemas.description: Scheme to use for connecting to the host.

schemas.name: name
schemas.description: The header field name

schemas.name: value
schemas.description: The header field value

schemas.name: path
schemas.description: Path to access on the HTTP server.

schemas.name: port
schemas.description: Name or number of the port to access on the container. Number must be in the range 1 to 65535. Name must be an IANA_SVC_NAME.

schemas.name: scheme
schemas.description: Scheme to use for connecting to the host.

schemas.name: tcp_socket
schemas.description: TCPSocket specifies an action involving a TCP port. TCP hooks not yet supported

schemas.description: Number or name of the port to access on the container. Number must be in the range 1 to 65535. Name must be an IANA_SVC_NAME.

schemas.name: liveness_probe
schemas.description: Periodic probe of container liveness. Container will be restarted if the probe fails. Cannot be updated. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/pod-states#container-probes

schemas.name: timeout_seconds
schemas.description: Number of seconds after which the probe times out. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/pod-states#container-probes

schemas.name: name
schemas.description: Name of the container specified as a DNS_LABEL. Each container in a pod must have a unique name (DNS_LABEL). Cannot be updated.

schemas.name: port
schemas.description: List of ports to expose from the container. Exposing a port here gives the system additional information about the network connections a container uses, but is primarily informational. Not specifying a port here DOES NOT prevent that port from being exposed. Any port which is listening on the default "0.0.0.0" address inside a container will be accessible from the network. Cannot be updated.

schemas.name: container_port
schemas.description: Number of port to expose on the pod's IP address. This must be a valid port number, 0 < x < 65536.

schemas.name: host_ip
schemas.description: What host IP to bind the external port to.

schemas.name: host_port
schemas.description: Number of port to expose on the host. If specified, this must be a valid port number, 0 < x < 65536. If HostNetwork is specified, this must match ContainerPort. Most containers do not need this.

schemas.name: name
schemas.description: If specified, this must be an IANA_SVC_NAME and unique within the pod. Each named port in a pod must have a unique name. Name for the port that can be referred to by services

schemas.name: protocol
schemas.description: Protocol for port. Must be UDP or TCP. Defaults to "TCP".

schemas.name: readiness_probe
schemas.description: Periodic probe of container service readiness. Container will be removed from service endpoints if the probe fails. Cannot be updated. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/pod-states#container-probes

schemas.description: exec specifies the action to take.

schemas.name: resources
schemas.description: Compute Resources required by this container. Cannot be updated. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/persistent-volumes#resources

schemas.name: limits
schemas.description: Describes the maximum amount of compute resources allowed. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/compute-resources/

schemas.name: security_context
schemas.description: Security options the pod should run with. More info: http://releases.k8s.io/HEAD/docs/design/security_context.md

schemas.name: capabilities
schemas.description: The capabilities to add/drop when running containers. Defaults to the default set of capabilities granted by the container runtime.

schemas.name: add
schemas.description: Added capabilities

schemas.name: drop
schemas.description: Removed capabilities

schemas.name: privileged
schemas.description: Run container in privileged mode. Processes in privileged containers are essentially equivalent to root on the host.

schemas.name: read_only_root_filesystem
schemas.description: Whether this container has a read-only root filesystem.

schemas.name: run_as_non_root
schemas.description: Indicates that the container must run as a non-root user. If true, the Kubelet will validate the image at runtime to ensure that it does not run as UID 0 (root) and fail to start the container if it does.

schemas.name: run_as_user
schemas.description: The UID to run the entrypoint of the container process. Defaults to user specified in image metadata if unspecified

schemas.name: se_linux_options
schemas.description: ImagePullSecrets is an optional list of references to secrets in the same namespace to use for pulling any of the images used by this PodSpec. If specified, these secrets will be passed to individual puller implementations for them to use. For example, in the case of docker, only DockerConfig type secrets are honored. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/images#specifying-imagepullsecrets-on-a-pod

schemas.name: level
schemas.description: Level is SELinux level label that applies to the container.

schemas.name: role
schemas.description: Role is a SELinux role label that applies to the container.

schemas.name: type
schemas.description: Type is a SELinux type label that applies to the container.

schemas.name: user
schemas.description: User is a SELinux user label that applies to the container.

schemas.name: stdin
schemas.description: Whether this container should allocate a buffer for stdin in the container runtime. If this is not set, reads from stdin in the container will always result in EOF.

schemas.name: stdin_once
schemas.description: Whether the container runtime should close the stdin channel after it has been opened by a single attach. When stdin is true the stdin stream will remain open across multiple attach sessions. If stdinOnce is set to true, stdin is opened on container start, is empty until the first client attaches to stdin, and then remains open and accepts data until the client disconnects, at which time stdin is closed and remains closed until the container is restarted. If this flag is false, a container processes that reads from stdin will never receive an EOF.

schemas.name: termination_message_path
schemas.description: Optional: Path at which the file to which the container's termination message will be written is mounted into the container's filesystem. Message written is intended to be brief final status, such as an assertion failure message. Defaults to /dev/termination-log. Cannot be updated.

schemas.name: tty
schemas.description: Whether this container should allocate a TTY for itself

schemas.name: volume_mount
schemas.description: Pod volumes to mount into the container's filesystem. Cannot be updated.

schemas.name: mount_path
schemas.description: Path within the container at which the volume should be mounted. Must not contain ':'.

schemas.name: name
schemas.description: This must match the Name of a Volume.

schemas.name: read_only
schemas.description: Mounted read-only if true, read-write otherwise (false or unspecified). Defaults to false.

schemas.name: sub_path
schemas.description: Path within the volume from which the container's volume should be mounted. Defaults to "" (volume's root).

schemas.name: working_dir
schemas.description: Container's working directory. If not specified, the container runtime's default will be used, which might be configured in the container image. Cannot be updated.

schemas.name: node_name
schemas.description: NodeName is a request to schedule this pod onto a specific node. If it is non-empty, the scheduler simply schedules this pod onto that node, assuming that it fits resource requirements.

schemas.name: node_selector
schemas.description: NodeSelector is a selector which must be true for the pod to fit on a node. Selector which must match a node's labels for the pod to be scheduled on that node. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/node-selection.

schemas.name: restart_policy
schemas.description: Restart policy for all containers within the pod. One of Always, OnFailure, Never. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/pod-states#restartpolicy.

schemas.name: security_context
schemas.description: SecurityContext holds pod-level security attributes and common container settings. Optional: Defaults to empty

schemas.name: fs_group
schemas.description: A special supplemental group that applies to all containers in a pod. Some volume types allow the Kubelet to change the ownership of that volume to be owned by the pod: 1. The owning GID will be the FSGroup 2. The setgid bit is set (new files created in the volume will be owned by FSGroup) 3. The permission bits are OR'd with rw-rw---- If unset, the Kubelet will not modify the ownership and permissions of any volume.

schemas.name: run_as_non_root
schemas.description: Indicates that the container must run as a non-root user. If true, the Kubelet will validate the image at runtime to ensure that it does not run as UID 0 (root) and fail to start the container if it does.

schemas.name: run_as_user
schemas.description: The UID to run the entrypoint of the container process. Defaults to user specified in image metadata if unspecified

schemas.name: se_linux_options
schemas.description: The SELinux context to be applied to all containers. If unspecified, the container runtime will allocate a random SELinux context for each container. May also be set in SecurityContext. If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence for that container.

schemas.name: level
schemas.description: Level is SELinux level label that applies to the container.

schemas.name: role
schemas.description: Role is a SELinux role label that applies to the container.

schemas.name: type
schemas.description: Type is a SELinux type label that applies to the container.

schemas.name: user
schemas.description: User is a SELinux user label that applies to the container.

schemas.name: supplemental_groups
schemas.description: A list of groups applied to the first process run in each container, in addition to the container's primary GID. If unspecified, no groups will be added to any container.

schemas.name: service_account_name
schemas.description: ServiceAccountName is the name of the ServiceAccount to use to run this pod. More info: http://releases.k8s.io/HEAD/docs/design/service_accounts.md.

schemas.name: subdomain
schemas.description: If specified, the fully qualified Pod hostname will be "...svc.". If not specified, the pod will not have a domainname at all..

schemas.name: termination_grace_period_seconds
schemas.description: Optional duration in seconds the pod needs to terminate gracefully. May be decreased in delete request. Value must be non-negative integer. The value zero indicates delete immediately. If this value is nil, the default grace period will be used instead. The grace period is the duration in seconds after the processes running in the pod are sent a termination signal and the time when the processes are forcibly halted with a kill signal. Set this value longer than the expected cleanup time for your process.

schemas.name: volume
schemas.description: List of volumes that can be mounted by containers belonging to the pod. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/volumes

schemas.name: aws_elastic_block_store
schemas.description: Represents an AWS Disk resource that is attached to a kubelet's host machine and then exposed to the pod. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/volumes#awselasticblockstore

schemas.name: fs_type
schemas.description: Filesystem type of the volume that you want to mount. Tip: Ensure that the filesystem type is supported by the host operating system. Examples: "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs". Implicitly inferred to be "ext4" if unspecified. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/volumes#awselasticblockstore

schemas.name: partition
schemas.description: The partition in the volume that you want to mount. If omitted, the default is to mount by volume name. Examples: For volume /dev/sda1, you specify the partition as "1". Similarly, the volume partition for /dev/sda is "0" (or you can leave the property empty).

schemas.name: read_only
schemas.description: Whether to set the read-only property in VolumeMounts to "true". If omitted, the default is "false". More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/volumes#awselasticblockstore

schemas.name: volume_id
schemas.description: Unique ID of the persistent disk resource in AWS (Amazon EBS volume). More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/volumes#awselasticblockstore

schemas.name: azure_disk
schemas.description: Represents an Azure Data Disk mount on the host and bind mount to the pod.

schemas.name: caching_mode
schemas.description: Host Caching mode: None, Read Only, Read Write.

schemas.name: data_disk_uri
schemas.description: The URI the data disk in the blob storage

schemas.name: disk_name
schemas.description: The Name of the data disk in the blob storage

schemas.name: fs_type
schemas.description: Filesystem type to mount. Must be a filesystem type supported by the host operating system. Ex. "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs". Implicitly inferred to be "ext4" if unspecified.

schemas.name: read_only
schemas.description: Whether to force the read-only setting in VolumeMounts. Defaults to false (read/write).

schemas.name: azure_file
schemas.description: Represents an Azure File Service mount on the host and bind mount to the pod.

schemas.name: read_only
schemas.description: Whether to force the read-only setting in VolumeMounts. Defaults to false (read/write).

schemas.name: secret_name
schemas.description: The name of secret that contains Azure Storage Account Name and Key

schemas.name: share_name
schemas.description: Share Name

schemas.name: ceph_fs
schemas.description: Represents a Ceph FS mount on the host that shares a pod's lifetime

schemas.name: monitors
schemas.description: Monitors is a collection of Ceph monitors More info: http://releases.k8s.io/HEAD/examples/volumes/cephfs/README.md#how-to-use-it

schemas.name: path
schemas.description: Used as the mounted root, rather than the full Ceph tree, default is /

schemas.name: read_only
schemas.description: Whether to force the read-only setting in VolumeMounts. Defaults to `false` (read/write). More info: http://releases.k8s.io/HEAD/examples/volumes/cephfs/README.md#how-to-use-it

schemas.name: secret_file
schemas.description: The path to key ring for User, default is /etc/ceph/user.secret More info: http://releases.k8s.io/HEAD/examples/volumes/cephfs/README.md#how-to-use-it

schemas.name: secret_ref
schemas.description: Reference to the authentication secret for User, default is empty. More info: http://releases.k8s.io/HEAD/examples/volumes/cephfs/README.md#how-to-use-it

schemas.name: name
schemas.description: Name of the referent. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#names

schemas.name: user
schemas.description: User is the rados user name, default is admin. More info: http://releases.k8s.io/HEAD/examples/volumes/cephfs/README.md#how-to-use-it

schemas.name: cinder
schemas.description: Represents a cinder volume attached and mounted on kubelets host machine. More info: http://releases.k8s.io/HEAD/examples/mysql-cinder-pd/README.md

schemas.name: fs_type
schemas.description: Filesystem type to mount. Must be a filesystem type supported by the host operating system. Examples: "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs". Implicitly inferred to be "ext4" if unspecified. More info: http://releases.k8s.io/HEAD/examples/mysql-cinder-pd/README.md

schemas.name: read_only
schemas.description: Whether to force the read-only setting in VolumeMounts. Defaults to false (read/write). More info: http://releases.k8s.io/HEAD/examples/mysql-cinder-pd/README.md

schemas.name: volume_id
schemas.description: Volume ID used to identify the volume in Cinder. More info: http://releases.k8s.io/HEAD/examples/mysql-cinder-pd/README.md

schemas.name: config_map
schemas.description: ConfigMap represents a configMap that should populate this volume

schemas.name: default_mode
schemas.description: Optional: mode bits to use on created files by default. Must be a value between 0 and 0777. Defaults to 0644. Directories within the path are not affected by this setting. This might be in conflict with other options that affect the file mode, like fsGroup, and the result can be other mode bits set.

schemas.name: items
schemas.description: If unspecified, each key-value pair in the Data field of the referenced ConfigMap will be projected into the volume as a file whose name is the key and content is the value. If specified, the listed keys will be projected into the specified paths, and unlisted keys will not be present. If a key is specified which is not present in the ConfigMap, the volume setup will error. Paths must be relative and may not contain the '..' path or start with '..'.

schemas.name: key
schemas.description: The key to project.

schemas.name: mode
schemas.description: Optional: mode bits to use on this file, must be a value between 0 and 0777. If not specified, the volume defaultMode will be used. This might be in conflict with other options that affect the file mode, like fsGroup, and the result can be other mode bits set.

schemas.name: path
schemas.description: The relative path of the file to map the key to. May not be an absolute path. May not contain the path element '..'. May not start with the string '..'.

schemas.name: name
schemas.description: Name of the referent. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#names

schemas.name: downward_api
schemas.description: DownwardAPI represents downward API about the pod that should populate this volume

schemas.name: default_mode
schemas.description: Optional: mode bits to use on created files by default. Must be a value between 0 and 0777. Defaults to 0644. Directories within the path are not affected by this setting. This might be in conflict with other options that affect the file mode, like fsGroup, and the result can be other mode bits set.

schemas.name: items
schemas.description: If unspecified, each key-value pair in the Data field of the referenced ConfigMap will be projected into the volume as a file whose name is the key and content is the value. If specified, the listed keys will be projected into the specified paths, and unlisted keys will not be present. If a key is specified which is not present in the ConfigMap, the volume setup will error. Paths must be relative and may not contain the '..' path or start with '..'.

schemas.name: field_ref
schemas.description: Required: Selects a field of the pod: only annotations, labels, name and namespace are supported.

schemas.name: api_version
schemas.description: Version of the schema the FieldPath is written in terms of, defaults to "v1".

schemas.name: field_path
schemas.description: Path of the field to select in the specified API version

schemas.name: mode
schemas.description: Optional: mode bits to use on this file, must be a value between 0 and 0777. If not specified, the volume defaultMode will be used. This might be in conflict with other options that affect the file mode, like fsGroup, and the result can be other mode bits set.

schemas.name: path
schemas.description: Path is the relative path name of the file to be created. Must not be absolute or contain the '..' path. Must be utf-8 encoded. The first item of the relative path must not start with '..'

schemas.name: resource_field_ref
schemas.description: Selects a resource of the container: only resources limits and requests (limits.cpu, limits.memory, requests.cpu and requests.memory) are currently supported.

schemas.name: resource
schemas.description: Resource to select

schemas.name: empty_dir
schemas.description: EmptyDir represents a temporary directory that shares a pod's lifetime. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/volumes#emptydir

schemas.name: medium
schemas.description: What type of storage medium should back this directory. The default is "" which means to use the node's default medium. Must be an empty string (default) or Memory. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/volumes#emptydir

schemas.name: fc
schemas.description: Represents a Fibre Channel resource that is attached to a kubelet's host machine and then exposed to the pod.

schemas.name: fs_type
schemas.description: Filesystem type to mount. Must be a filesystem type supported by the host operating system. Ex. "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs". Implicitly inferred to be "ext4" if unspecified.

schemas.name: lun
schemas.description: FC target lun number

schemas.name: read_only
schemas.description: Whether to force the read-only setting in VolumeMounts. Defaults to false (read/write).

schemas.name: target_ww_ns
schemas.description: FC target worldwide names (WWNs)

schemas.name: flex_volume
schemas.description: Represents a generic volume resource that is provisioned/attached using an exec based plugin. This is an alpha feature and may change in future.

schemas.name: driver
schemas.description: Driver is the name of the driver to use for this volume.

schemas.name: fs_type
schemas.description: Filesystem type to mount. Must be a filesystem type supported by the host operating system. Ex. "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs". The default filesystem depends on FlexVolume script.

schemas.name: options
schemas.description: Extra command options if any.

schemas.name: read_only
schemas.description: Whether to force the ReadOnly setting in VolumeMounts. Defaults to false (read/write).

schemas.name: secret_ref
schemas.description: Reference to the secret object containing sensitive information to pass to the plugin scripts. This may be empty if no secret object is specified. If the secret object contains more than one secret, all secrets are passed to the plugin scripts.

schemas.name: name
schemas.description: Name of the referent. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#names

schemas.name: flocker
schemas.description: Represents a Flocker volume attached to a kubelet's host machine and exposed to the pod for its usage. This depends on the Flocker control service being running

schemas.name: dataset_name
schemas.description: Name of the dataset stored as metadata -> name on the dataset for Flocker should be considered as deprecated

schemas.name: dataset_uuid
schemas.description: UUID of the dataset. This is unique identifier of a Flocker dataset

schemas.name: gce_persistent_disk
schemas.description: Represents a GCE Disk resource that is attached to a kubelet's host machine and then exposed to the pod. Provisioned by an admin. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/volumes#gcepersistentdisk

schemas.name: fs_type
schemas.description: Filesystem type of the volume that you want to mount. Tip: Ensure that the filesystem type is supported by the host operating system. Examples: "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs". Implicitly inferred to be "ext4" if unspecified. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/volumes#gcepersistentdisk

schemas.name: partition
schemas.description: The partition in the volume that you want to mount. If omitted, the default is to mount by volume name. Examples: For volume /dev/sda1, you specify the partition as "1". Similarly, the volume partition for /dev/sda is "0" (or you can leave the property empty). More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/volumes#gcepersistentdisk

schemas.name: pd_name
schemas.description: Unique name of the PD resource in GCE. Used to identify the disk in GCE. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/volumes#gcepersistentdisk

schemas.name: read_only
schemas.description: Whether to force the ReadOnly setting in VolumeMounts. Defaults to false. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/volumes#gcepersistentdisk

schemas.name: git_repo
schemas.description: GitRepo represents a git repository at a particular revision.

schemas.name: directory
schemas.description: Target directory name. Must not contain or start with '..'. If '.' is supplied, the volume directory will be the git repository. Otherwise, if specified, the volume will contain the git repository in the subdirectory with the given name.

schemas.name: repository
schemas.description: Repository URL

schemas.name: revision
schemas.description: Commit hash for the specified revision.

schemas.name: glusterfs
schemas.description: Represents a Glusterfs volume that is attached to a host and exposed to the pod. Provisioned by an admin. More info: http://releases.k8s.io/HEAD/examples/volumes/glusterfs/README.md

schemas.name: endpoints_name
schemas.description: The endpoint name that details Glusterfs topology. More info: http://releases.k8s.io/HEAD/examples/volumes/glusterfs/README.md#create-a-pod

schemas.name: path
schemas.description: The Glusterfs volume path. More info: http://releases.k8s.io/HEAD/examples/volumes/glusterfs/README.md#create-a-pod

schemas.name: read_only
schemas.description: Whether to force the Glusterfs volume to be mounted with read-only permissions. Defaults to false. More info: http://releases.k8s.io/HEAD/examples/volumes/glusterfs/README.md#create-a-pod

schemas.name: host_path
schemas.description: Represents a directory on the host. Provisioned by a developer or tester. This is useful for single-node development and testing only! On-host storage is not supported in any way and WILL NOT WORK in a multi-node cluster. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/volumes#hostpath

schemas.name: path
schemas.description: Path of the directory on the host. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/volumes#hostpath

schemas.name: iscsi
schemas.description: Represents an ISCSI Disk resource that is attached to a kubelet's host machine and then exposed to the pod. Provisioned by an admin.

schemas.name: fs_type
schemas.description: Filesystem type of the volume that you want to mount. Tip: Ensure that the filesystem type is supported by the host operating system. Examples: "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs". Implicitly inferred to be "ext4" if unspecified. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/volumes#iscsi

schemas.name: iqn
schemas.description: Target iSCSI Qualified Name.

schemas.name: iscsi_interface

schemas.name: keyring

schemas.name: name

schemas.name: secret

schemas.name: default_mode
schemas.description: Optional: mode bits to use on created files by default. Must be a value between 0 and 0777. Defaults to 0644. Directories within the path are not affected by this setting. This might be in conflict with other options that affect the file mode, like fsGroup, and the result can be other mode bits set.

schemas.name: items
schemas.description: If unspecified, each key-value pair in the Data field of the referenced Secret will be projected into the volume as a file whose name is the key and content is the value. If specified, the listed keys will be projected into the specified paths, and unlisted keys will not be present. If a key is specified which is not present in the Secret, the volume setup will error unless it is marked optional. Paths must be relative and may not contain the '..' path or start with '..'.

schemas.name: key
schemas.description: The key to project.

schemas.name: path

schemas.name: generation

schemas.name: resource_version

schemas.name: min_ready_seconds
schemas.description: Minimum number of seconds for which a newly created pod should be ready without any of its container crashing, for it to be considered available. Defaults to 0 (pod will be considered available as soon as it is ready)

schemas.name: replicas
schemas.description: The number of desired replicas. Defaults to 1. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/replication-controller#what-is-a-replication-controller

schemas.name: selector
schemas.description: A label query over pods that should match the Replicas count. If Selector is empty, it is defaulted to the labels present on the Pod template. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/labels#label-selectors

schemas.name: active_deadline_seconds

schemas.name: container

schemas.name: args

Escaped references will never be expanded, regardless of whether the variable exists or not. Cannot be updated. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/containers#containers-and-commands

schemas.description: Indicates that the container must run as a non-root user. If true, the Kubelet will validate the image at runtime to ensure that it does not run as UID 0 (root) and fail to start the container if it does.

schemas.description: The UID to run the entrypoint of the container process. Defaults to user specified in image metadata if unspecified

More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/images#specifying-imagepullsecrets-on-a-pod

schemas.name: level
schemas.description: Level is SELinux level label that applies to the container.

schemas.name: role
schemas.description: Role is a SELinux role label that applies to the container.

schemas.name: type
schemas.description: Type is a SELinux type label that applies to the container.

schemas.name: user
schemas.description: User is a SELinux user label that applies to the container.

schemas.name: stdin
schemas.description: Whether this container should allocate a buffer for stdin in the container runtime. If this is not set, reads from stdin in the container will always result in EOF.

schemas.name: stdin_once
schemas.description: Whether the container runtime should close the stdin channel after it has been opened by a single attach. When stdin is true the stdin stream will remain open across multiple attach sessions. If stdinOnce is set to true, stdin is opened on container start, is empty until the first client attaches to stdin, and then remains open and accepts data until the client disconnects, at which time stdin is closed and remains closed until the container is restarted. If this flag is false, a container processes that reads from stdin will never receive an EOF.

schemas.name: termination_message_path
schemas.description: Optional: Path at which the file to which the container's termination message will be written is mounted into the container's filesystem. Escaped references will never be expanded, regardless of whether the variable exists or not. Cannot be updated. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/containers#containers-and-commands

schemas.name: command

The $(VAR_NAME) syntax can be escaped with a double $$, ie: $$(VAR_NAME). Escaped references will never be expanded, regardless of whether the variable exists or not. Cannot be updated. Escaped references will never be expanded, regardless of whether the variable exists or not. Defaults to "".

More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/images#specifying-imagepullsecrets-on-a-pod

schemas.name: level
schemas.description: Level is SELinux level label that applies to the container.

schemas.name: role
schemas.description: Role is a SELinux role label that applies to the container.

schemas.name: type
schemas.description: Type is a SELinux type label that applies to the container.

schemas.name: user
schemas.description: User is a SELinux user label that applies to the container.

schemas.name: stdin
schemas.description: Whether this container should allocate a buffer for stdin in the container runtime. If this is not set, reads from stdin in the container will always result in EOF.

schemas.name: stdin_once
schemas.description: Whether the container runtime should close the stdin channel after it has been opened by a single attach. When stdin is true the stdin stream will remain open across multiple attach sessions. If stdinOnce is set to true, stdin is opened on container start, is empty until the first client attaches to stdin, and then remains open and accepts data until the client disconnects, at which time stdin is closed and remains closed until the container is restarted. If this flag is false, a container processes that reads from stdin will never receive an EOF.

schemas.name: termination_message_path
schemas.description: Optional: Path at which the file to which the container's termination message will be written is mounted into the container's filesystem. Message written is intended to be brief final status, such as an assertion failure message. Defaults to /dev/termination-log. Cannot be updated.

schemas.name: tty
schemas.description: Whether this container should allocate a TTY for itself

schemas.name: volume_mount
schemas.description: Pod volumes to mount into the container's filesystem. Cannot be updated.

schemas.description: Path within the container at which the volume should be mounted. Must not contain ':'.

schemas.description: This must match the Name of a Volume.

schemas.name: read_only
schemas.description: Mounted read-only if true, read-write otherwise (false or unspecified). Defaults to false.

schemas.name: sub_path
schemas.description: Path within the volume from which the container's volume should be mounted. Defaults to "" (volume's root).

schemas.name: working_dir
schemas.description: Container's working directory. If not specified, the container runtime's default will be used, which might be configured in the container image. Cannot be updated.

schemas.name: node_name
schemas.description: NodeName is a request to schedule this pod onto a specific node. If it is non-empty, the scheduler simply schedules this pod onto that node, assuming that it fits resource requirements.

schemas.name: node_selector

schemas.name: restart_policy
schemas.description: Restart policy for all containers within the pod. One of Always, OnFailure, Never. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/pod-states#restartpolicy.

schemas.name: security_context
schemas.description: SecurityContext holds pod-level security attributes and common container settings. Optional: Defaults to empty

schemas.name: fs_group
schemas.description: A special supplemental group that applies to all containers in a pod. Some volume types allow the Kubelet to change the ownership of that volume to be owned by the pod: 1. The owning GID will be the FSGroup 2. The setgid bit is set (new files created in the volume will be owned by FSGroup) 3. The permission bits are OR'd with rw-rw---- If unset, the Kubelet will not modify the ownership and permissions of any volume.

schemas.name: run_as_non_root
schemas.description: Indicates that the container must run as a non-root user. If true, the Kubelet will validate the image at runtime to ensure that it does not run as UID 0 (root) and fail to start the container if it does.

schemas.name: run_as_user
schemas.description: The UID to run the entrypoint of the container process. Defaults to user specified in image metadata if unspecified

schemas.name: se_linux_options
schemas.description: The SELinux context to be applied to all containers. If unspecified, the container runtime will allocate a random SELinux context for each container. May also be set in SecurityContext. If set in both SecurityContext and PodSecurityContext, the value specified in SecurityContext takes precedence for that container.

schemas.name: level
schemas.description: Level is SELinux level label that applies to the container.

schemas.name: role
schemas.description: Role is a SELinux role label that applies to the container.

schemas.name: type
schemas.description: Type is a SELinux type label that applies to the container.

schemas.name: user
schemas.description: User is a SELinux user label that applies to the container.

schemas.name: supplemental_groups
schemas.description: A list of groups applied to the first process run in each container, in addition to the container's primary GID. If unspecified, no groups will be added to any container.

schemas.name: service_account_name
schemas.description: ServiceAccountName is the name of the ServiceAccount to use to run this pod. More info: http://releases.k8s.io/HEAD/docs/design/service_accounts.md.

schemas.name: subdomain
schemas.description: If specified, the fully qualified Pod hostname will be "...svc.". If not specified, the pod will not have a domainname at all..

schemas.name: termination_grace_period_seconds
schemas.description: Optional duration in seconds the pod needs to terminate gracefully. May be decreased in delete request. Value must be non-negative integer. The value zero indicates delete immediately. If this value is nil, the default grace period will be used instead. The grace period is the duration in seconds after the processes running in the pod are sent a termination signal and the time when the processes are forcibly halted with a kill signal. Set this value longer than the expected cleanup time for your process.

schemas.description: Filesystem type to mount. Must be a filesystem type supported by the host operating system. Ex. "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs". Implicitly inferred to be "ext4" if unspecified.

schemas.name: lun
schemas.description: FC target lun number

schemas.name: read_only
schemas.description: Whether to force the read-only setting in VolumeMounts. Defaults to false (read/write).

schemas.name: flex_volume
schemas.description: Represents a generic volume resource that is provisioned/attached using an exec based plugin. This is an alpha feature and may change in future.

schemas.name: driver
schemas.description: Driver is the name of the driver to use for this volume.

schemas.name: fs_type
schemas.description: Filesystem type to mount. Must be a filesystem type supported by the host operating system. Ex. "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs". The default filesystem depends on FlexVolume script.

schemas.name: options
schemas.description: Extra command options if any.

schemas.name: read_only
schemas.description: Whether to force the ReadOnly setting in VolumeMounts. Defaults to false (read/write).

schemas.name: secret_ref
schemas.description: Reference to the secret object containing sensitive information to pass to the plugin scripts. This may be empty if no secret object is specified. If the secret object contains more than one secret, all secrets are passed to the plugin scripts.

schemas.name: name
schemas.description: Name of the referent. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#names

schemas.name: flocker

schemas.name: dataset_name
schemas.description: Name of the dataset stored as metadata -> name on the dataset for Flocker should be considered as deprecated

schemas.name: dataset_uuid
schemas.description: UUID of the dataset. This is unique identifier of a Flocker dataset

schemas.name: gce_persistent_disk
schemas.description: Represents a GCE Disk resource that is attached to a kubelet's host machine and then exposed to the pod. Provisioned by an admin. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/volumes#gcepersistentdisk

schemas.name: fs_type
schemas.description: Filesystem type of the volume that you want to mount. Tip: Ensure that the filesystem type is supported by the host operating system. Examples: "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs". Implicitly inferred to be "ext4" if unspecified. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/volumes#gcepersistentdisk

schemas.name: partition
schemas.description: The partition in the volume that you want to mount. If omitted, the default is to mount by volume name. Examples: For volume /dev/sda1, you specify the partition as "1". Similarly, the volume partition for /dev/sda is "0" (or you can leave the property empty). More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/volumes#gcepersistentdisk

schemas.name: pd_name
schemas.description: Unique name of the PD resource in GCE. Used to identify the disk in GCE. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/volumes#gcepersistentdisk

schemas.name: read_only
schemas.description: Whether to force the ReadOnly setting in VolumeMounts. Defaults to false. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/volumes#gcepersistentdisk

schemas.name: git_repo
schemas.description: GitRepo represents a git repository at a particular revision.

schemas.name: directory
schemas.description: Target directory name. Must not contain or start with '..'. If '.' is supplied, the volume directory will be the git repository. Otherwise, if specified, the volume will contain the git repository in the subdirectory with the given name.

schemas.name: repository
schemas.description: Repository URL

schemas.name: revision
schemas.description: Commit hash for the specified revision.

schemas.description: The Glusterfs volume path. More info: http://releases.k8s.io/HEAD/examples/volumes/glusterfs/README.md#create-a-pod

schemas.description: Whether to force the Glusterfs volume to be mounted with read-only permissions. Defaults to false. More info: http://releases.k8s.io/HEAD/examples/volumes/glusterfs/README.md#create-a-pod

schemas.name: host_path
schemas.description: Represents a directory on the host. Provisioned by a developer or tester. This is useful for single-node development and testing only! schemas.name: user

schemas.description: Volume is a string that references an already created Quobyte volume by name.

schemas.name: default_mode
schemas.description: Optional: mode bits to use on created files by default. Must be a value between 0 and 0777. Defaults to 0644. Directories within the path are not affected by this setting. This might be in conflict with other options that affect the file mode, like fsGroup, and the result can be other mode bits set.

schemas.name: items
schemas.description: If unspecified, each key-value pair in the Data field of the referenced Secret will be projected into the volume as a file whose name is the key and content is the value. If specified, the listed keys will be projected into the specified paths, and unlisted keys will not be present. If a key is specified which is not present in the Secret, the volume setup will error unless it is marked optional. Paths must be relative and may not contain the '..' path or start with '..'.

schemas.name: key
schemas.description: The key to project.

schemas.name: mode
schemas.description: Optional: mode bits to use on this file, must be a value between 0 and 0777. If not specified, the volume defaultMode will be used. This might be in conflict with other options that affect the file mode, like fsGroup, and the result can be other mode bits set.

schemas.name: path
schemas.description: The relative path of the file to map the key to. May not be an absolute path. May not contain the path element '..'. May not start with the string '..'.

schemas.name: optional

schemas.name: cluster_ip
schemas.description: The IP address of the service. It is usually assigned randomly by the master. If an address is specified manually and is not in use by others, it will be allocated to the service; otherwise, creation of the service will fail. `None` can be specified for headless services when proxying is not required. Ignored if type is `ExternalName`. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/services#virtual-ips-and-service-proxies

schemas.name: external_ips
schemas.description: A list of IP addresses for which nodes in the cluster will also accept traffic for this service. These IPs are not managed by Kubernetes. The user is responsible for ensuring that traffic arrives at a node with this IP.  A common example is external load-balancers that are not part of the Kubernetes system.

schemas.name: external_name
schemas.description: The external reference that kubedns or equivalent will return as a CNAME record for this service. No proxying will be involved. Must be a valid DNS name and requires `type` to be `ExternalName`.

schemas.name: load_balancer_ip
schemas.description: Only applies to `type = LoadBalancer`. LoadBalancer will get created with the IP specified in this field. This feature depends on whether the underlying cloud-provider supports specifying this field when a load balancer is created. This field will be ignored if the cloud-provider does not support the feature.

schemas.name: load_balancer_source_ranges
schemas.description: If specified and supported by the platform, this will restrict traffic through the cloud-provider load-balancer will be restricted to the specified client IPs. This field will be ignored if the cloud-provider does not support the feature. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/services-firewalls

schemas.name: node_port

More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/services#type--nodeport

schemas.description: Determines how the service is exposed. Defaults to `ClusterIP`. Valid options are `ExternalName`, `ClusterIP`, `NodePort`, and `LoadBalancer`. `ExternalName` maps to the specified `external_name`. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/services#overview

schemas.name: external_name
schemas.description: The external reference that kubedns or equivalent will return as a CNAME record for this service. No proxying will be involved. Must be a valid DNS name and requires `type` to be `ExternalName`.

schemas.name: load_balancer_ip
schemas.description: Only applies to `type = LoadBalancer`. LoadBalancer will get created with the IP specified in this field. This feature depends on whether the underlying cloud-provider supports specifying this field when a load balancer is created. This field will be ignored if the cloud-provider does not support the feature.

schemas.name: load_balancer_source_ranges
schemas.description: If specified and supported by the platform, this will restrict traffic through the cloud-provider load-balancer will be restricted to the specified client IPs. This field will be ignored if the cloud-provider does not support the feature. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/services-firewalls

schemas.name: port
schemas.description: The list of ports that are exposed by this service. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/services#virtual-ips-and-service-proxies

schemas.name: name
schemas.description: The name of this port within the service. All ports within the service must have unique names. Optional if only one ServicePort is defined on this service.

schemas.name: node_port
schemas.description: The port on each node on which this service is exposed when `type` is `NodePort` or `LoadBalancer`. Usually assigned by the system. If specified, it will be allocated to the service if unused or else creation of the service will fail. Default is to auto-allocate a port if the `type` of this service requires one. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/services#type--nodeport

schemas.name: port
schemas.description: The port that will be exposed by this service.

schemas.name: protocol
schemas.description: The IP protocol for this port. Supports `TCP` and `UDP`. Default is `TCP`.

schemas.name: target_port
schemas.description: Number or name of the port to access on the pods targeted by the service. Number must be in the range 1 to 65535. This field is ignored for services with `cluster_ip = "None"`. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/services#defining-a-service

schemas.name: selector
schemas.description: Route service traffic to pods with label keys and values matching this selector. Only applies to types `ClusterIP`, `NodePort`, and `LoadBalancer`. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/services#overview

schemas.name: session_affinity
schemas.description: Used to maintain session affinity. Supports `ClientIP` and `None`. Defaults to `None`. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/services#virtual-ips-and-service-proxies

schemas.name: type
schemas.description: Determines how the service is exposed. Defaults to `ClusterIP`. Valid options are `ExternalName`, `ClusterIP`, `NodePort`, and `LoadBalancer`. `ExternalName` maps to the specified `external_name`. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/services#overview

schemas.name: metadata
schemas.description: Standard storage class's metadata. More info: https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/devel/api-conventions.md#metadata

schemas.name: annotations
schemas.description: An unstructured key value map stored with the storage class that may be used to store arbitrary metadata. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/annotations

schemas.name: generation
schemas.description: A sequence number representing a specific generation of the desired state.

schemas.name: labels
schemas.description: Map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize (scope and select) the storage class. May match selectors of replication controllers and services. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/labels

schemas.name: name
schemas.description: Name of the storage class, must be unique. Cannot be updated. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#names

schemas.name: resource_version
schemas.description: An opaque value that represents the internal version of this storage class that can be used by clients to determine when storage class has changed. Read more: https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/devel/api-conventions.md#concurrency-control-and-consistency

schemas.name: self_link
schemas.description: A URL representing this storage class.

schemas.name: uid
schemas.description: The unique in time and space value for this storage class. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#uids

schemas.name: parameters
schemas.description: The parameters for the provisioner that should create volumes of this storage class

schemas.name: storage_provisioner
schemas.description: Indicates the type of the provisioner
